message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.DS 

This paper discusses the performance analysis and construction of polar codes, which are a type of error-correcting code used in information theory. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also proposes encoding structures and a generalised decoder, which falls under the sub-categories of cs.CC (Computational Complexity) and cs.SI (Systems and Control). The analysis of polarisation distance and erasure rate involves statistical analysis, which could be categorised under cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Finally, the investigation of finite-length cases and code lengths not equal to powers of 2 could be considered as a problem in cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
